Body:
I have a Azure IoT Hub with 2 Devices. I send a Message from a RaspberryPi to another Device.

How do I know that the message was received from the other Device?

You can refer to the Device Explorer tool, which is open sourced.

If you want to monitor if an IoT device is reachable by the IoT Hub, you can got to Message To Device" tab
column9: select the IoT device in the Device ID tab
column10: and make sure you checked "Monitor Feedback Endpoint". Whenever a message is sent from the IoT Hub to the device
column11:
and callback(feedback) message will be showing the status of the message.

If you want to do it programatically
column12: refer to the DeviceExplorer source code https://github.com/Azure/azure-iot-sdks/tree/master/tools/DeviceExplorer/DeviceExplorer
column14:
from line 726.

"

Body: How can I do in c# code?

There is a cross-platform Azure IoT Toolkit extension for Visual Studio Code to make you able to monitor whether the message is sent to Azure IoT Hub. You could send C2D message and Direct Method to your device. Also
column9:
you could see whether the device is connected or disconnected.

"

Body: In Azure IoT Toolkit, you could use `Start monitoring D2C message` to see whether the message is sent.

I am using await iotHubClient.GetDeviceClient().SendEventAsync(messageToSend).ConfigureAwait(false);   How do I know if message is delivered successfully or not? I do not see any call back in device client SDK!
Can we monitor after deployment in prod?
@codetoshare Sure, you could monitor after deployment in prod
